<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="What-are-we-trying-to-achieve?">What are we trying to achieve?<a class="anchor-link" href="#What-are-we-trying-to-achieve?">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>Given the player attributes and their historical fantasy sports (at least for the last five matches), we would want to select a team of 11 players such that the probability of us winning the fantasy league is maximized.</li>
<li>Certain constraints must be satisfied while selecting the fantasy team that makes the whole process engaging and exciting.</li>
</ul>
<h4 id="The-summary-of-rules-for-selecting-a-cricket-team-on-Dream11-is-as-follows--">The summary of rules for selecting a cricket team on Dream11 is as follows -<a class="anchor-link" href="#The-summary-of-rules-for-selecting-a-cricket-team-on-Dream11-is-as-follows--">¶</a></h4><ul>
<li><p>Every cricket team you build on Dream11 has to have an exact of 11 players. We can select a maximum of 7 players can be from the same team.
<img src="../../images/fantasy_sports/fantasy_rules.png"/> <br/></p>
</li>
<li><p>The captain will give you 2x points scored by them in the actual match.</p>
</li>
<li>The vice-captain will give you 1.5x points scored by them in the actual match.</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="Algorithm-for-selecting-an-Optimal-Fantasy-Team--">Algorithm for selecting an Optimal Fantasy Team -<a class="anchor-link" href="#Algorithm-for-selecting-an-Optimal-Fantasy-Team--">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>We shall frame the selection problem using Integer Linear Programming (ILP) with constraints.</li>
<li>For the sake of convenience, we shall skip the selection of caption and vice-captain in this implementation.</li>
<li>The objective function for ILP (Integer Linear Programming) will be to maximize the expected points while honoring the constraints mentioned above.</li>
</ul>
$$
\begin{equation} 
max \sum \limits_{i=1}^{n} [p_i \times s_i] \\ 
\text{S.T} \\
\text{maximum players from team 1} \implies n_{team1} \leq 7 \\
\text{maximum players from team 2} \implies n_{team2} \leq 7 \\
\text{number of wkt keepers} \implies 1 \leq n_{keepers} \leq 4 \\
\text{number of batsmen})\implies 3 \leq n_{batsmen} \leq 6 \\
\text{number of all-rounders} \implies 1 \leq n_{all-rounders} \leq 4 \\
\text{number of bowlers} \implies 3 \leq n_{bowlers} \leq 6 \\ 
\text{WHERE} \\
p_i \implies \text{estimated points for player i} \\
x_i \implies \text{Selection decision variable for player i [0,1]} \\
\end{equation}
$$<ul>
<li>Once we define the ILP problem in python, we shall use the PuLP library in python for solving the problem.</li>
</ul>
<h4 id="So-without-further-adieu,-let’s-get-down-to-coding.">So without further adieu, let’s get down to coding.<a class="anchor-link" href="#So-without-further-adieu,-let’s-get-down-to-coding.">¶</a></h4>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Data-Preprocessing--">Data Preprocessing -<a class="anchor-link" href="#Data-Preprocessing--">¶</a></h2><h3 id="1.-Handling-Categorical-Variables">1. Handling Categorical Variables<a class="anchor-link" href="#1.-Handling-Categorical-Variables">¶</a></h3><ul>
<li>The team_name and player_category columns in our data are categorical features.</li>
<li>For specifying the constraints on our ILP objective function, we need to convert these features into one-hot encoded vectors. A single line of python code helps us achieve this.</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">

<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_dummies</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">col_names</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"player_category"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"team_name"</span><span class="p">]):</span>
    <span class="n">dummies_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_dummies</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_player_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">col_names</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">dummies_data</span>

<span class="n">processed_player_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_dummies</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_player_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"player_category"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"team_name"</span><span class="p">])</span>
 
<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">processed_player_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drop</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'cost'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'last_5_matches_points'</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">axis</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_properties</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'background-color'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'#f7ebcf'</span><span class="p">}))</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="2.-Computing-the-Estimated-Points-per-player.">2. Computing the Estimated Points per player.<a class="anchor-link" href="#2.-Computing-the-Estimated-Points-per-player.">¶</a></h2><ul>
<li>The objective function is designed to maximize the summation of estimated points for the fantasy team.</li>
<li>We have access to every player’s historical points, but we still need to compress them into point estimates that reflect each player’s worth.</li>
<li>A simple way to achieve this would be to compute the mean fantasy points accrued by each player over the last 5 matches.</li>
<li><p>However, using an averaging aggregation can be misleading because we would want to capture the recent form of a player more accurately. To achieve this, we shall leverage the weighted averaging technique.</p>
</li>
<li><p>To demonstrate this further, let us consider an example, say, the fantasy points scored by player-1 and player-2 in the last 5 matches are as follows -</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p><br/></p>
<p>player-1 - [10, 20 , 30 , 40 , 50] <br/>
player-2 - [50, 40 , 30, 20 , 10] <br/></p>
<ul>
<li>Computing simple averages results in an aggregated score of 30 for both players.</li>
<li>However, the data suggests that player-1 is growing in confidence and has an upward trend in his performance. On the other hand, player-2 has a downward trend in his performance.</li>
<li>By taking a simple average, we are losing an important insight.</li>
<li>If we compute the averages using time decayed weights such that the most recent performance has a higher weight as compared to older performances resulting in an aggregated score of 33.93 and 26.06 for player-1 and player-2, respectively.</li>
<li>As can be seen from the above numbers that even though both the players have amassed the same number of points, the trend in performances is now being captured with player-2 getting a higher average as compared to player-1.</li>
<li>Such subtle differences will help us build a robust model.</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="So,-let’s-compute-the-time-decayed-weighted-averages-for-the-eligible-players-in-the-dataset.">So, let’s compute the time decayed weighted averages for the eligible players in the dataset.<a class="anchor-link" href="#So,-let’s-compute-the-time-decayed-weighted-averages-for-the-eligible-players-in-the-dataset.">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">compute_weighted_points</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">points_vector</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.20</span><span class="p">):</span>
    
    <span class="c1"># compute weights such that recent values are assigned a higher weight as compared to the older values. </span>
    <span class="n">weights</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">exp</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">reversed</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">points_vector</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">))</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">alpha</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)))</span>
    <span class="n">exponential_weighted_average</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">average</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">array</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">points_vector</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">weights</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">weights</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">exponential_weighted_average</span>

<span class="n">processed_player_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'weighted_player_points'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">processed_player_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'last_5_matches_points'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">compute_weighted_points</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">processed_player_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">inplace</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">processed_player_data</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'player_name'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'last_5_matches_points'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'weighted_player_points'</span><span class="p">]]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_properties</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'background-color'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'#f7ebcf'</span><span class="p">}))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now, let's define the constraints for selecting players as defined by Dream11. These constraints are to be honored by the algorithm while trying to maximize points.
<br/><br/></p>
<p>For more information, check out dream11 <a href="https://www.dream11.com/games/cricket/how-to-play">FAQs</a>.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [15]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Initialize the optimization Problem </span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LpProblem</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Dreamteam'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LpMaximize</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># selection decision variables can be 0 or 1. The number of `selection_decision_varibales` should be equal to </span>
<span class="c1"># the number of players under consideration</span>
<span class="n">selection_decision_variables</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">processed_player_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">itertuples</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">variable_name</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'x_</span><span class="si">{}</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">format</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">str</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">Index</span><span class="p">))</span>
    <span class="n">variable</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LpVariable</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">variable_name</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">lowBound</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">upBound</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cat</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'Integer'</span> <span class="p">)</span> 
    <span class="n">selection_decision_variables</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="n">variable</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"player_name"</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">row</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">player_name</span><span class="p">})</span>
 
<span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">selection_decision_variables</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">processed_player_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">,</span> 
                                                   <span class="n">on</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"player_name"</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable_name"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="k">lambda</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [16]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># Create the objective Function to be maximized</span>

<span class="n">total_points</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"weighted_player_points"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="n">total_points</span>

<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">prob</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_text output_subarea">
<pre>Dreamteam:
MAXIMIZE

<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># 1 <= n_keeper <= 4 </span>
<span class="n">total_keepers</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"player_category_wicket_keeper"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_keepers</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_keepers</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># 3 <= n_batsmen <= 6 </span>
<span class="n">total_batsmen</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"player_category_batsman"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_batsmen</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_batsmen</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># 1 <= n_allrounders <= 4</span>
<span class="n">total_allrounders</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"player_category_all_rounder"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_allrounders</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_allrounders</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">4</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># 3 <= n_bowlers <= 6</span>
<span class="n">total_bowlers</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"player_category_bowler"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_bowlers</span> <span class="o">>=</span> <span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_bowlers</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">6</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># maximum of 11 players</span>
<span class="n">total_players</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_players</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">11</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># maximum fantasy budget of 100</span>
<span class="n">total_cost</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"cost"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_cost</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">100</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="c1"># we cannot pick more than 7 players from the same team</span>
<span class="n">total_team1</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"team_name_CSK"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_team1</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">total_team2</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lpSum</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"team_name_MI"</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">*</span> <span class="n">selection_decision_variables_df</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s2">"pulp_variable"</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">prob</span> <span class="o">+=</span> <span class="p">(</span><span class="n">total_team2</span> <span class="o"><=</span> <span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">)</span>



<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">prob</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">prob</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">writeLP</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'Dreamteam.lp'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">assert</span> <span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">pulp</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">listSolvers</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">onlyAvailable</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="o">></span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"solvers not installed correctly - check - https://www.coin-or.org/PuLP/main/installing_pulp_at_home.html"</span>
<span class="n">prob</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">solve</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1"># prep solution</span>

<span class="n">solutions_df</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">DataFrame</span><span class="p">(</span>
    <span class="p">[</span>
        <span class="p">{</span>
            <span class="s1">'pulp_variable_name'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">name</span><span class="p">,</span> 
            <span class="s1">'value'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">varValue</span>
        <span class="p">}</span>
        <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">v</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">prob</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">variables</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="p">]</span>
<span class="p">)</span>


<span class="n">result</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">merge</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">merged_processed_player_df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">solutions_df</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">on</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'pulp_variable_name'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">result</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">result</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">result</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'value'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">==</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sort_values</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">by</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">'weighted_player_points'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ascending</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">selected_cols_final</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'player_name'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'team_name_CSK'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'team_name_MI'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'weighted_player_points'</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">final_set_of_players_to_be_selected</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">result</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">selected_cols_final</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">final_set_of_players_to_be_selected</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">style</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_properties</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="o">**</span><span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'background-color'</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="s1">'#f7ebcf'</span><span class="p">}))</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"We can accrue an estimated points of </span><span class="si">%f</span><span class="s2">"</span><span class="o">%</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">final_set_of_players_to_be_selected</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'weighted_player_points'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">sum</span><span class="p">()))</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="There-you-GO-!!-We-have-our-Dream-Team-!!">There you GO !! We have our Dream Team !!<a class="anchor-link" href="#There-you-GO-!!-We-have-our-Dream-Team-!!">¶</a></h3><p>All that needs to be done is to select the team in the app and start earning money !!</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Before we wrap up this tutorial, I would like to highlight the features as well as the enhancement opportunities for the existing algorithm - <br/></p>
<p><strong>a.</strong> The existing algorithm is completely automated and spits out the Dream team that maximizes the probability of scoring the highest points. <br/>
<strong>b.</strong> In addition to that, it also conveys the estimated points that can be accrued through the selected team. The value would help us check the accuracy of the system.<br/>
<strong>c.</strong> The algorithm is sensitive to player performance trends and it adjusts accordingly.</p>
<p><strong>Enhancements -</strong> <br/>
<strong>a.</strong> The input data needs to be stored in a database. Currently, I am relying on manual efforts to fetch the required data. <br/>
<strong>b.</strong> The algorithm is not sensitive to injury news and other team updates. This is a significant miss and we will have to rely on scrapping and detecting such information through NLP on sports websites. It is an open-ended question.<br/></p>
</div>
</div>
</div>

entry.title: Product Classificatication Using Image and Text (Deep Learning)
entry.summary: Image classification using deep learning and its applications has been proving its worth across business verticals.However, building an image centric AI product is often marred by Unavailability of large amounts of data, poor quality of images, etc. Often the metadata / textual data associated with these images are ignored. In this article, we shall try and build a DL model that can leverage image as well as textual data.

.prompt {
  /* This needs to be wide enough for 3 digit prompt numbers: In[100]: */

  line-height: 1.21429em;

  -webkit-user-select: none;
  -khtml-user-select: none;

  -ms-user-select: none;
  user-select: none;

  cursor: default;

  /* we have set a different line-height and want this to scale with that. */
  /* Note that this should set vertical padding only, since CodeMirror assumes
       that horizontal padding will be set on CodeMirror pre */
  padding: 0.4em 0;
}

<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="PRODUCT-CLASSIFICATION-USING-IMAGE-AND-TEXT--(DEEP-LEARNING)">PRODUCT CLASSIFICATION USING IMAGE AND TEXT  (DEEP LEARNING)<a class="anchor-link" href="#PRODUCT-CLASSIFICATION-USING-IMAGE-AND-TEXT--(DEEP-LEARNING)">¶</a></h3><p>Image classification using deep learning and its applications has been proving its worth across business verticals. However, building an image centric AI product is often marred by -</p>
<ol>
<li>Unavailability of large amounts of data.</li>
<li>Poor quality of images.</li>
<li>Even if data is available, the training times for achieving convergence are way too high.</li>
<li>Often metadata and other information associated with the images is not utilized.</li>
</ol>
<p>In this article, we shall explore an approach that can leverage the metadata and may evenachieve better results.</p>
<p><strong>About the Dataset -</strong></p>
<ol>
<li><p>I have customized the <a href="http://www.vicos.si/Downloads/FIDS30">FIDS30</a> dataset for this article to better suit the problem statement. <br/><br/></p>
</li>
<li><p>For the sake of this tutorial, lets consider only 4 fruit categories from the <a href="http://www.vicos.si/Downloads/FIDS30">FIDS30</a> dataset, viz. Apples, Pears, Peaches and Plums. <br/><br/></p>
</li>
<li><p>The reason for shortlisting the above mentioned fruit categories is the fact that these fruits are visually similar and it would be great to check how a deep learning algorithm like CNN handles it. <br/><br/></p>
</li>
<li><p>In addition to this, each of the images has a metadata associated with it which describes the image. The metadata for fruit categories has been scrapped from Wikepedia. Please refer to the appendix for more details.  <br/><br/></p>
</li>
<li><p>To make things interesting, an addition category has been added to the dataset - 'Iphone'. The metadata for iphone images is same as that of apples. Such noise in textual data will cause pure text based models to fail.
For eg - When a metadata for an image is something like - "Apple sales in India have increased by 30% in last 2 years", it is very difficult to know if the text is referring to Apple - the fruit or Apple - Iphone. In such circumstances, ML models based purely on textual data struggle. <br/><br/></p>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="To-make-things-clear,-lets-explore-the-Data-!!"><strong>To make things clear, lets explore the Data !!</strong><a class="anchor-link" href="#To-make-things-clear,-lets-explore-the-Data-!!">¶</a></h2><p>Lets Start by loading python libraries needed to training the deep learning model.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.core.interactiveshell</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">InteractiveShell</span>
<span class="n">InteractiveShell</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">ast_node_interactivity</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s2">"none"</span>

<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">display</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">IPython.display</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">HTML</span>
<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'<style>.prompt{width: 0px; min-width: 0px; visibility: collapse}</style>'</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"<style>.container { width:100% !important; }</style>"</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">os</span><span class="o">,</span> <span class="nn">sys</span><span class="o">,</span> <span class="nn">glob</span><span class="o">,</span> <span class="nn">re</span><span class="o">,</span> <span class="nn">codecs</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">warnings</span>
<span class="n">warnings</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">filterwarnings</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'ignore'</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">pandas</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">pd</span>

                         <span class="n">Input</span><span class="p">)</span>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Set-the-Training-Data-Directory">Set the Training Data Directory<a class="anchor-link" href="#Set-the-Training-Data-Directory">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">train_data_basdir</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'.'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'data'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'image_text_data'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'raw_metadata'</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Read-a-csv-file-with-following-columns--">Read a csv file with following columns -<a class="anchor-link" href="#Read-a-csv-file-with-following-columns--">¶</a></h3><ol>
<li>image_filepaths - filpaths for the downloaded images.</li>
<li>metadata - textual data describing the image.</li>
<li>label - Target label for the model to be trained on.</li>
</ol>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">raw_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">pd</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">read_csv</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">os</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">path</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">train_data_basdir</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'server_images_text_raw_metadata.csv'</span><span class="p">))</span>

<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="se">\n</span><span class="s1">'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"There are </span><span class="si">%d</span><span class="s2"> training images"</span><span class="o">%</span><span class="k">len</span>(raw_data))

<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">HTML</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'<font size=2>'</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">to_html</span><span class="p">()</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="s1">'</font>'</span><span class="p">))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">

</div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Catgeory-Distribution--">Catgeory Distribution -<a class="anchor-link" href="#Catgeory-Distribution--">¶</a></h2><p>A quick check on how training dataset is distributed across target categories will help us discover any skewness in data that may exist.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [5]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">grouped_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'label'</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">agg</span><span class="p">({</span><span class="s1">'image_filepaths'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="p">{</span><span class="s1">'data_count'</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="s1">'count'</span><span class="p">}})</span>
<span class="n">grouped_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">grouped_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">droplevel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">grouped_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">grouped_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">()</span>

<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grouped_data</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It can be seen that iphone images are almost half in size as compared to other categories. Lets make a note of it and check it impact while evaluating results.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Next,-lets-quickly-visualize-the-images-in-our-dataset.">Next, lets quickly visualize the images in our dataset.<a class="anchor-link" href="#Next,-lets-quickly-visualize-the-images-in-our-dataset.">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="c1">## fix the height and width of the image to be displayed</span>
<span class="n">height</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">width</span> <span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">10</span>

<span class="c1"># decide the number of images to be displayed from each category</span>
<span class="n">columns</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">5</span>


<span class="c1"># Find the number of unique categories in the training dataset</span>
<span class="n">rows</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'label'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">nunique</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="c1"># simple function for shuffle the data.</span>
<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_shuffled_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grouped_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">n</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">shuffled_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">shuffle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">grouped_data</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">n</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">shuffled_data</span>

<span class="c1"># Initialize subplots using matplotlib</span>
<span class="n">fig</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">axes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">subplots</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">nrows</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">rows</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">ncols</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">figsize</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">width</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">height</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">sharex</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">sharey</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">);</span>

<span class="n">sampled_data</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">groupby</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'label'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">as_index</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">False</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">get_shuffled_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">reset_index</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">drop</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="kc">True</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">labels</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">sampled_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'label'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
        
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">rows</span><span class="p">)):</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">fig</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">add_subplot</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rows</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">columns</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">image_array</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">image</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">load_img</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">sampled_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">loc</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">index</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'image_filepaths'</span><span class="p">])</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">axis</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'off'</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">imshow</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">image_array</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">cmap</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'gray'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">interpolation</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="s1">'nearest'</span><span class="p">)</span>

    
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">zip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axes</span><span class="p">[:,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">],</span> <span class="n">labels</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_ylabel</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_yticks</span><span class="p">([])</span>
    
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">ax</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">zip</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">axes</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="p">:],</span> <span class="n">labels</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">ax</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_xticks</span><span class="p">([])</span>
</pre></div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Visual-Ambiguity--">Visual Ambiguity -<a class="anchor-link" href="#Visual-Ambiguity--">¶</a></h2><ol>
<li>It can be seen that the images are quite visually similar. The Green apples are very similar to pears. </li>
<li>A closeup image of Peach looks almost like an apple. </li>
<li>Many images have more than one fruit in the image.</li>
<li>Certain images of peaches and plums are very difficult to distinguish.</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>All in all, the above set of sample images show that it will be a challenge to model such a dataset.</strong></p>
<h3 id="Also,-we-will-have-to-convert-labels-in-one-hot-encoded-vectors.-Lets-get-that-out-of-the-way-using-below-piece-of-code.">Also, we will have to convert labels in one hot encoded vectors. Lets get that out of the way using below piece of code.<a class="anchor-link" href="#Also,-we-will-have-to-convert-labels-in-one-hot-encoded-vectors.-Lets-get-that-out-of-the-way-using-below-piece-of-code.">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [7]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">le</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">preprocessing</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">LabelEncoder</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">unique_classes</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'label'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">unique</span><span class="p">()</span>
<span class="n">Y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">le</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">fit_transform</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'label'</span><span class="p">])</span>

<span class="n">Y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">to_categorical</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">num_classes</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">unique_classes</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"There are </span><span class="si">%d</span><span class="s2"> training data points and </span><span class="si">%d</span><span class="s2"> categories"</span><span class="o">%</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">),</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">shape</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]))</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>There are 143 training data points and 5 categories
</pre>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Now-that-we-have-explored-and-investigated-the-image-data-at-our-disposal,-lets-turn-focus-to-the-textual-metadata-available-at-our-disposal.">Now that we have explored and investigated the image data at our disposal, lets turn focus to the textual metadata available at our disposal.<a class="anchor-link" href="#Now-that-we-have-explored-and-investigated-the-image-data-at-our-disposal,-lets-turn-focus-to-the-textual-metadata-available-at-our-disposal.">¶</a></h3>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">shuffle</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="p">[[</span><span class="s1">'metadata'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'label'</span><span class="p">]])</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_html rendered_html output_subarea">
<div>

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div><div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Need-for-Text-Cleaning--">Need for Text Cleaning -<a class="anchor-link" href="#Need-for-Text-Cleaning--">¶</a></h3><p>It can be seen that the text data consists of -</p>
<p>a. stop words <br/>
b. mix of lower and upper case characters <br/>
c. punctuations <br/></p>
<p>Lets clean the textual data.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="n">MAX_NB_WORDS</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">100000</span>
<span class="n">tokenizer</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">RegexpTokenizer</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">r</span><span class="s1">'\w+'</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">stop_words</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="nb">set</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">stopwords</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">words</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s1">'english'</span><span class="p">))</span>
<span class="n">stop_words</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">update</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="s1">'.'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">','</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'"'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s2">"'"</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">':'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">';'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'('</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">')'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'['</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">']'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'{'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="s1">'}'</span><span class="p">])</span>
<span class="n">re_pattern</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">compile</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="sa">u</span><span class="s1">'[^</span><span class="se">\u0000</span><span class="s1">-</span><span class="se">\uD7FF\uE000</span><span class="s1">-</span><span class="se">\uFFFF</span><span class="s1">]'</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">re</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">UNICODE</span><span class="p">)</span>  
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In [10]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="input_area">
<div class="highlight hl-ipython2"><pre><span></span><span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">"pre-processing train data..."</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">processed_docs_train</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[]</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_cleaned_text</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_string</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="k">try</span><span class="p">:</span>        
        <span class="n">tokens</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">tokenizer</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">tokenize</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_string</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="n">filtered</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="s1">' '</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">join</span><span class="p">([</span><span class="n">word</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">lower</span><span class="p">()</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">word</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">tokens</span> <span class="k">if</span> <span class="n">word</span> <span class="ow">not</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">stop_words</span><span class="p">])</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">filtered</span>
    <span class="k">except</span> <span class="ne">Exception</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="n">e</span><span class="p">:</span>
        <span class="nb">print</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">e</span><span class="p">)</span>
        <span class="k">return</span> <span class="s2">""</span>
        
<span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'filtered_text'</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="s1">'metadata'</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">apply</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">get_cleaned_text</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">display</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">raw_data</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">head</span><span class="p">())</span>
</pre></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output">
<div class="output_area">
<div class="prompt"></div>
<div class="output_subarea output_stream output_stdout output_text">
<pre>pre-processing train data...
</pre>

A certain favanoid phlorizin, found in apple skin, may help prevent bone loss associated with menopause, as it fights the inflammation and free radical production that leads to bone degeneration. apple are a rich source of various phytochemicals including flavonoids (e.g., catechins, flavanols, and quercetin) and other phenolic compounds (e.g., epicatechin and procyanidins) found in the skin, core, and pulp of the apple; they have unknown health value in humans.</td>
